decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful equipment cards to quickly pump up creatures and deal direct damage to the opponent. With cards like Colossus Hammer and Sigarda's Aid, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Fervent Champion and Kellan, the Fae-Blooded. The inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Leyline Axe provide additional utility and flexibility in combat. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, allowing for a consistent curve of creatures and equipment to apply pressure early in the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing low-cost creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It aims to maintain a fast tempo using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also utilizing burn spells like Fiery Impulse and Cori-Steel Cutter to remove opposing creatures and finish off the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Experimental Synthesizer and Stormchaser's Talent provide card advantage and additional damage options. The mana base is designed to support the quick playstyle of the deck by providing a consistent source of both red and blue mana.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures in a Selesnya Aggro strategy. Utilizing cards like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Skyclave Apparition and Badgermole Cub to apply pressure. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence with mana ramp from cards like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, followed by powerful plays like Collected Company to maintain momentum and seal the victory.

The main focus of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Emberheart Challenger, and Soul-Scar Mage. The deck aims to utilize cards like Monstrous Rage and Reckless Rage to enhance the damage output of these creatures. The deck also includes spells like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent to control the board and enable quick aggression. Overall, the deck is designed to continually apply pressure and overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle.

The main idea of this deck is to use cheap spells and card draw to quickly bring back powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix. By utilizing cards like Artist's Talent, Consider, and Sleight of Hand, the deck can dig through the library and fill the graveyard with spells to easily bring back the Phoenix. The deck also includes other aggressive creatures and removal spells to maintain board control while setting up for big plays with Arclight Phoenix. Overall, the deck focuses on speed and efficiency to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early with efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria and Badgermole Cub while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition. It also aims to ramp up quickly with mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to cast powerful spells like Collected Company. The deck also has some resilience with cards like Selfless Spirit and Ouroboroid to protect key creatures and maintain tempo. Overall, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and disruptive strategy.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively attack the opponent using low-cost creatures like Emberheart Challenger, Monastery Swiftspear, and Soul-Scar Mage, while also utilizing spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage to clear the way and deal direct damage. The deck also includes draw power with cards like Academic Dispute and Stock Up, along with some tempo control with Boomerang Basics and Experimental Synthesizer. Overall, the key strategy is to apply consistent pressure on the opponent and keep the board in your favor with efficient and versatile cards.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with low-cost creatures and pump spells in order to quickly reduce their life total to zero. It aims to control the board with removal and disruption spells, while also utilizing card draw and versatility to maintain pressure and keep opponents on the back foot. By efficiently using its resources and maintaining a fast-paced tempo, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing legendary creatures and artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By using cards like Mox Amber and Relic of Legends to ramp up mana quickly, the deck can play powerful legendary creatures like Gran-Gran, Jirina, and Cecil to put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Honest Rutstein and Arachne provide further support for the aggressive game plan, while a mix of different lands ensures smooth mana development. The deck aims to establish board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature play, efficient removal spells, and disruptive hand disruption spells to control the game tempo. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent, while also disrupting their game plan using cards like Duress and Thoughtseize. Bloodtithe Harvester and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker are key creature cards that can swing the game in your favor. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats on the board. The combination of aggression and disruption makes this deck a formidable opponent in 1 vs 1 Pioneer matches.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for powerful creatures and disrupt your opponent's strategies. By utilizing different creatures with various abilities like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Angel of Serenity, as well as versatile spell cards like Get Lost and Seam Rip, you can slow down your opponent and gain an advantage. The mana base is set up to support the multiple colors needed for the powerful creatures and spells in the deck, allowing for flexibility in your plays.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger to deal damage early and often. Spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage are used to remove opposing threats while also boosting the power of our creatures. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent to maintain hand advantage and find the right cards at the right time. The mana base is built around efficient dual lands like Spirebluff Canal and Shivan Reef to ensure consistent access to both red and blue mana sources.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on applying pressure to the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Thoughtseize to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to finish the game swiftly. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger allows the deck to close out games even in the late stages. Overall, this deck aims to be proactive and punishing, maintaining a strong tempo throughout the match.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan with efficient creatures and spells. By leveraging the powerful effect of Collected Company, the deck can outpace opponents with a wide board presence. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition provide additional disruption to slow down the opponent, while Ouroboroid and Voice of Resurgence generate value and protect the board. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, allowing for consistent and smooth gameplay.

The deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures quickly, while disrupting opponents' game plan with cards that restrict their spellcasting. It utilizes mana-producing creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to ramp up and cast powerful spells like Collected Company and Archon of Emeria. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben further slows down opponents, while Skyclave Apparition and Aven Interrupter provide removal options. The deck also includes Enduring Innocence and Ouroboroid for additional disruption, while featuring Boseiju, Who Endures for spell protection. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and disruptive aggro strategy.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of cheap, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, along with burn spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage. The deck focuses on utilizing spells like Academic Dispute and Stock Up to maintain card advantage, while also leveraging cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Experimental Synthesizer to control the board and push through damage. The inclusion of Boomerang Basics and Den of the Bugbear adds additional versatility and threats to keep the opponent on their toes.
